headline.main: BARS U.S. CARRIERS FROM C0NVOY GROUP; Neutrality Act Still Forbids Use of Our Merchant Ships in Such Guise NAVY QUESTION APART Supporters of President Contend His Powers Under the Constitution Are Unlimited

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 -- The opinion expressed yesterday by Secretary Knox that the President now possesses legal authority to employ the Navy in convoy work does not affect, so far as could be learned today, the prohibition in the Neutrality Act against the use of United States merchant ships in convoys.
abstract: Wash comment on Neutrality Act provisions
